name: Papa-paparazzi
description: Media attention and paparazzi from the assassination of JFK to Lady Gaga's music video.

key_work.title: Bell and Howell Zoomatic Director Series Model 414 PD
key_work.brief_description: The Bell and Howell Model is the same type of camera used by Abraham Zapruder, who was dubbed the first “citizen journalist” after he inadvertently captured the assassination of US President John F. Kennedy on camera in 1963.

start.title: Jackie
start.creator_credit: Ari Handel, Darren Aronofsky, Juan de Dios Larraín, Mickey Liddell, Scott Franklin and LD Entertainment
start.headline_credit: Chile, China, France, Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2016
start.brief_description: An account of the days of First Lady, Jacqueline Kennedy, in the immediate aftermath of John F. Kennedy’s assassination in 1963.

end.title: A Tour of the White House with Mrs. John F. Kennedy
end.brief_description: Tour of the White House with Mrs. John F. Kennedy was a television special featuring the First Lady of the United States, Jacqueline Kennedy on a tour of the recently renovated White House.

constellations_other.name: Papa-paparazzi
constellations_other.description: Media attention and paparazzi from the assassination of JFK to Lady Gaga's music video.

links.description: The film also faithfully recreates the First Lady’s tour of the White House, which was broadcast on television in 1962, and offered audiences a glimpse into the private lives of the couple’s highly publicised personas.

start.title: Jackie
start.creator_credit: Ari Handel, Darren Aronofsky, Juan de Dios Larraín, Mickey Liddell, Scott Franklin and LD Entertainment

end.title: Smash His Camera
end.brief_description: A film centering on the life and work of Ron Galella that examines the nature and effect of paparazzi.

constellations_other.name: Papa-paparazzi
constellations_other.description: Media attention and paparazzi from the assassination of JFK to Lady Gaga's music video.

links.description: Widely known for his obsessive pursuit of Jackie Kennedy Onassis, tabloid photographer Ron Galella is often referred to as the ‘godfather of paparazzi’. The title of the documentary refers to Onassis’s directive to her security guard to ‘break his camera’.

start.title: Smash His Camera
start.brief_description: A film centering on the life and work of Ron Galella that examines the nature and effect of paparazzi.

end.title: La Dolce Vita
end.creator_credit: Piero Gherardi, Angelo Rizzoli, Giuseppe Amato, Cinecittà, Ennio Flaiano, Federico Fellini, Tullio Pinelli, Brunello Rondi and Pier Paolo Pasolini
end.brief_description: Journalist and man-about-town Marcello struggles to find his place in the world, torn between the allure of Rome’s elite social scene and the stifling domesticity offered by his girlfriend, all the while searching for a way to become a serious writer.

constellations_other.name: Papa-paparazzi
constellations_other.description: Media attention and paparazzi from the assassination of JFK to Lady Gaga's music video.

links.description: The term paparazzi comes from a character called Paparazzo, an invasive news photographer played by Walter Santesso in Federico Fellini’s lauded film. The director compared the name paparazzo to a term for an oversized mosquito.

start.title: Bell and Howell Zoomatic Director Series Model 414 PD
start.brief_description: The Bell and Howell Model is the same type of camera used by Abraham Zapruder, who was dubbed the first “citizen journalist” after he inadvertently captured the assassination of US President John F. Kennedy on camera in 1963.

constellations_other.name: Papa-paparazzi
constellations_other.description: Media attention and paparazzi from the assassination of JFK to Lady Gaga's music video.

links.description: In 1963, the assassination of JFK was captured by amateur videographer Abraham Zapruder on an 8mm Bell & Howell home movie camera. The iconic footage has been shown, recreated and reinterpreted in numerous films including Jackie, starring Natalie Portman.

start.title: La Dolce Vita

constellations_other.name: Papa-paparazzi
constellations_other.description: Media attention and paparazzi from the assassination of JFK to Lady Gaga's music video.

constellations_other.name: Weaving a dark web
constellations_other.description:
In contemporary Hollywood cinema, children's films often align with comedy and musical genres. However, harking back to the days of European fairytales (and certainly beyond), children's stories are historically dark in tone and were written for both children and adult audiences alike. 
With an apocalyptic threat looming large, Moomins and the Comet Chase veers more into darker territory. However, it is the talented voice cast that conjures some connections to some pure cinema darkness.

links.description: Lady Gaga’s music video ‘Paparazzi’, starring Alexander Skarsgard and directed by Jonas Akerlund, was inspired by celebrity experiences with intrusive photographers, including Princess Diana.

start.title: La Dolce Vita
start.creator_credit: Piero Gherardi, Angelo Rizzoli, Giuseppe Amato, Cinecittà, Ennio Flaiano, Federico Fellini, Tullio Pinelli, Brunello Rondi and Pier Paolo Pasolini
start.brief_description: Journalist and man-about-town Marcello struggles to find his place in the world, torn between the allure of Rome’s elite social scene and the stifling domesticity offered by his girlfriend, all the while searching for a way to become a serious writer.

end.title: Blow-Up
end.headline_credit: Italy, United Kingdom and United States of America, 1966
end.brief_description: A successful mod photographer in London whose world is bounded by fashion, pop music and sex is bored by his life. In the course of a single day, he accidentally captures on film the commission of a murder.

constellations_other.name: Papa-paparazzi
constellations_other.description: Media attention and paparazzi from the assassination of JFK to Lady Gaga's music video.

links.description: La Dolce Vita and Michelangelo Antonioni’s L’Avventura both premiered at the 1960 Cannes Film Festival. While the former received the Palm d’Or, the latter was booed. Six years later, Antonioni released this film about a fashion photographer who believes he’s captured a murder on film.
